Paragraph: 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 2f The formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm is crucial for charge generation and transportation.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network |
| between polymer donor and PCBM |
| with an ideal domain size |
| of 10-20 nm |
| crucial for charge generation |
| and transportation. |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| formation of an interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM |
| with an ideal domain size of 10-20 nm |
| crucial for charge generation |
| and transportation. |

The entities "ideal domain size" and "charge generation and transportation" are material properties. The other entities refer to the specific structure of the material (interpenetrating bicontinuous network between polymer donor and PCBM) and a desired range for that property (ideal domain size of 10-20 nm).
